intro: Aciotis brachybotrya, commonly known as the narrow-fruit aciotis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its small, spiny fruits are designed for dispersal by animals. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
